description.p: Standing tall and robust, the taii’maku are pacifist intellectuals who favor logic over emotions. They excel in math and engineering, creating remarkable inventions.

Ability Score Increase.
Your Constitution score increases by 1.

Creature Type.
You are a Humanoid.

Size.
You are Medium.

Speed.
Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Historical Nomadism
You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: History or Survival

Strong Hands
Endowed with six fingers, taii’makus possess enhanced hand strength. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to climbing and saving throws against disarming effects

Mathematical Mind.
The unique and logical thought process of the taii’maku grant them an edge with numbers and math. You have advantage on all ability checks directly involving mathematical or accounting tasks

Languages.
You can speak, read, and write Common and Taii'makian.

Mind Inclination
Rather than subspecies, taii’maku display dispositions inclined either towards Philosophy, with a comprehensive approach, or Engineering, focusing on specific areas of study

description.p:
Ability Score Increase.
Your Intelligence score increases by 2.
Innate Engineers.
You are proficient with tinker’s tools. Additionally, when analyzing a mechanism such as an automaton or a mechanical trap, you can attempt an Intelligence (Investigation) check to determine its purpose and function. If successful, you or creatures to whom you have explained the mechanism have advantage in ability checks made to use or disable it.
Ingenious Inventors
You gain a +2 bonus to all ability checks (including when using skills). If you are “in balance,” this bonus is also applied to all saving throws.
Expanded Insight
Using tinker’s tools, you can construct magical mechanisms. Spend 1 hour and 20 gp on materials to create a mechanism, limited to three at any given time. If you create a fourth, you must sever the magical connection with an existing one. When creating a mechanism, choose from the following options:
Extended Vision Module his device lets you see better. While wearing it, your vision range doubles, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. (Weight: 1)
Clock-CompassThis item always shows you the exact time and which way is north. (Weight: 0)
Sound AplifierThis device helps you hear better. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. Alternatively, you can use it to amplify your voice so it can be heard twice as far. (Weight: 1).
Foldable GliderThis item allows you to slow your fall and move forward. For every 5 feet you fall, you can move forward up to 5 feet reducing this distance from the fall, as long as you have enough space. If you can’t move forward you take the remaining damage as normal. (Weight: 4)
Mechanical ThrowerThis item lets you throw a weapon or improvised weapon 10 feet farther than normal. (Weight: 1)
Automatic Reloader This item lets you ignore the loading property of a ranged weapon you are wielding twice, recovering its uses on a short rest. (Weight: 2)
JumperThis gadget allows you to make extraordinary leaps. While wearing it, your jump range doubles, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to jumping. (Weight: 1)
ClimberThis item allows you to climb easily. While wearing it, climbing does not cost you extra movement, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to climbing. (Weight: 1)
Carrying FrameThis set of springs and gears helps you carry more weight. While wearing it, you are considered to have +3 to your Strength ability score for the purposes of calculating load and lifting weight, as well as for the Strength requirements of armor. (Weight: 3)
Potion InjectorThis contraption allows you to load a potion into a mounted reservoir at the end of a long rest. As a bonus action, you can inject the loaded potion directly into your bloodstream and receive its effects. (Weight: 2)
